Title: Meduza gained access to the correspondence of employees of IK-6, ...
Description: Meduza gained access to the correspondence of employees of IK-6, where Navalny was imprisoned. The letters indicate conditions of detention that were specially tightened for the politician - falsification of documents, censorship and a punishment cell for rolling up sleevesIn early August, the publication received from a source an archive of correspondence from employees of IK-6 (a maximum security colony in the village of Melekhovo Vladimir region, where Alexei Navalny spent most of his time), namely messages from the email of Ilya Kruglyshev, a lawyer who represented in the courts a maximum security penal colony in the village of Melekhovo. Letters about Navalny from his correspondence were sent out from May 2021 to February 2024. From today's publications it became clear: - In IK-6, documents were falsified to respond to Navalny‚Äôs claims about violations in the colony. For example, at the end of 2023, after Navalny disappeared, representatives of the Federal Penitentiary Service first explained his disappearance by power outages in the colony, then the lawyers were informed that the politician was no longer in IK-6. Three weeks later it turned out that he was transferred to a special regime colony in the village of Kharp in the Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug, where he was subsequently killed. After this, the head of IK-6, Dmitry Nozhkin, reported on the reasons for Navalny‚Äôs transfer, saying that he was transferred to Kharp due to the entry into force of a new sentence. However, in the first version of the document signed by Nozhkin, something else was stated - the reason for Navalny‚Äôs stage was the instruction of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia No. 02-6477-dsp (-for official use-) received by IK-6. By excluding this instruction from the final version, the colony staff were able to hide it from the lawyers.- The colony staff closely monitored the lawyers and read all the letters that Navalny sent and received, especially after the posts appeared online on behalf of Navalny, information from which was not mentioned in the wiretapped conversations between the politician and his wife and mother. Then the workers of IK-6 concluded that Navalny was transmitting the text for publication to his associates through lawyers. In response, the employees sealed the transparent plexiglass covering the grille that separated lawyers and clients in the room where their meetings take place, and got rid of a special slot for the transfer of documents, which is why Navalny‚Äôs lawyers could not transfer to him the materials of new criminal cases cases brought against the politician while he was in prison. And the lawyers also could not show these papers.- Navalny recorded a noticeable increase in blood pressure - 140/90. Such readings could be a sign of arterial hypertension and a reason for starting drug therapy. Navalny was not prescribed medications to lower blood pressure in IK-6. According to the official version of Navalny‚Äôs death, it was the -critical increase in blood pressure- that became the -trigger- for the development of the -combined disease-, which allegedly led to the death of the politician in February 2024. - Navalny was held in a punishment cell more than 300 days in two years. On one occasion, he was sent there because he rolled up the sleeves of his robe, which was several sizes too small for him. Each time, before this punishment, prisoners must be examined by doctors - Navalny complained of pain in his back, stomach and hands, but he was still sent to the isolation ward. - April 17, 2023, two employees of IK-6 ;‚Äî Alexey Kukushkin and Vladimir Katalev beat Navalny because he -categorically refused to enter the cell- of the punishment cell. After the beating, as Meduza writes, Navalny was escorted to the cell where the convicted A.A. Tatarchenko, who was specially put in the same cell with Navalny, since Tatarchenko was homeless and did not take care of hygiene, which made it impossible to be in the same room with him.- In October 2023, Navalny told his lawyer Olga Mikhailova that -it seems like I‚Äôm being bullied here.- About the possible poisoning of Navalny in the colony also statedThe Insider journalists, who claimed that before Navalny‚Äôs death he was vomiting and complained of -sharp pain in the abdominal area.- However, this information disappeared from the official document about the causes of Navalny‚Äôs death.

Description: Miners of Kuzbass went on hunger strike due to wage arrearsWorkers of the Inskaya mine -In the Belovsky district of the Kemerovo region they went on a hunger strike due to four months of wage arrears,  reports -Wednesday 42.-They set up two tents on the territory of the administrative and welfare complex of the mine and drew up a  application demanding immediate payments. It was signed by 12 people. According to the owner of the enterprise, Denis Nemykin, the total debts of the mine, including wages and tax payments, amounted to about 1.2 billion rubles. He promised the miners to pay part of their wages during the working week and asked them to extract part of the 300 thousand tons of coal remaining in the longwall. The employees refused to continue working, citing wear and tear on the equipment. According to Nemykin, the mine must produce more than 92 thousand tons per month to operate without losses. Moreover, in January 2024 alone, the enterprise produced more than 90 thousand tons.

Title: üñº In Moldova, during the presidential elections, no one was able...
Description: In the presidential elections in Moldova, no one was able to overcome the 50% threshold - the country will hold a second round. Meanwhile, supporters of the union are losing in the referendum on joining the EUPresidential elections were held in the Republic of Moldova on Sunday. There are 11 politicians vying for the presidency, including incumbent President Maia Sandu. After processing about 80% of the protocols, she gained 36% of the votes, in second place is the candidate from the Party of Socialists (PSRM) Alexandru Stoianoglo with 29%, in third place is Renato Usatii with 13%. Since none of the candidates passed the 50% threshold, the republic must undergo a second round of presidential elections. The current President of Moldova, Maia Sandu, is 52 years old and has served as president since 2022. In 2016, the politician founded the Action and Solidarity party (Partidul Ac»õiune »ôi Solidaritate - PAS), which a year later won early parliamentary elections and became the ruling party. She is a supporter of the republic joining the EUOn the same day, October 20, a referendum on the country's European integration was held in Moldova, which was supposed to determine whether membership in the European Union would become a strategic goal of the state, which would be spelled out in the Constitution. Voters received a referendum ballot along with the presidential election ballot. The question was formulated as follows:  -Do you support amending the Constitution in order for the Republic of Moldova to join the European Union?- and two answer options - -Yes- and -No-. After processing more than 50% of the ballots, the majority of voters were against European integration - about 55%, 44% of citizens were in favor of joining the EU, it follows from the preliminary results of the referendum, which are published by the country's Central Election Commission on its website site. There is currently no decision on either the second round of the presidential election or the result of the referendum.

Title: üñº -I didn‚Äôt ask to teach my child to pull the trigger-, - In the...
Description: -I didn‚Äôt ask to teach my child to pull the trigger,- ‚Äî In the Sverdlovsk region, the mother of a high school student was fined 30 thousand rubles after refusing to send her son to military trainingDuring the proceedings with the school, which involved the military registration and enlistment office, the police and the FSB, Yana Lisitsina was threatened to take her child away. About this reports -Novaya Gazeta-. Lisitsyna told the newspaper that she tried to protect her son from any military training at school. The woman planned that her son, instead of serving in the army, would go to alternative civilian service (ACS), and did not want her son to be -taught to pull the trigger.-On the eve of the training camp, in May 2024, Lisitsyna was summoned to the education department of the city of Berezovsky. -The representative of the commission said: -You know, it seems to us that you are a bad influence on your son. We will have conversations with him. We will question him in tests - psychological, socio-psychological... Do you understand how this will end?- I say: 'I don't understand.' He: ‚ÄòWe can take the child away from you.‚Äô I asked: ‚ÄòOn what basis?‚Äô He began to list some articles, but then the military commissar got involved,- the newspaper quotes Lisitsyna. The military commissar called the woman‚Äôs son a -draft dodger- and stated that the high school student -doesn‚Äôt want to defend the country- while -now bombs will fly on our heads.-According to the article about discrediting the army, a woman was fined because of her answer to the military commissar. Novaya Gazeta does not quote what was said verbatim because of the threat of being fined under the same article, but writes that the general meaning of the phrase was: -The country was not in any danger in February 2022.- However, as noted, in the protocol on discrediting Lisitsyna, completely different words were attributed that the woman did not utter. There are no audio recordings in the administrative file confirming her words. It is based on the testimony of the head of the city education department and the former former teacher of Lisitsyna‚Äôs son, who were present during the conversation with the military commissar. Later, representatives of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and an FSB officer tried to take the woman to court. The latter told Lisitsyna that-Our fight for Vanya could end badly because we contacted human rights activists. I recommended not to communicate with them.- Ultimately, the woman did not go to trial and was fined in absentia. -It seems to me that school should be a place where teachers are your child‚Äôs protectors. It‚Äôs terrible to realize that this is not so,- said Lisitsyna, who herself previously worked as a teacher in schools and kindergartens.

Title: üñº Roskomnadzor has made its register of blocking more closed. No...
Description: Roskomnadzor has made its register of blocking more closedNow it has become more difficult to find out about blocking of sites in Russia - RKN has changed the search mechanism for database of prohibited links on your website. Now, to find out about blocking, you need to enter the full address of the page, and not just its domain name. This makes using the registry much more difficult. The search mechanism for the database of blocked sites changed without warning this afternoon. Because of this, a number of media wrotethat Discord and Steam have disappeared from the registry - and, apparently , will be unlocked soon. Journalists simply could not find records about the blocking of Discord and Steam in the registry.Against this background, the RKN press service statedthat it sees no reason to unblock Discord. The department accompanied the message to journalists with an explanation: -Please note that <‚Ä¶> in the Unified Register of Prohibited Information of Roskomnadzor, it is necessary to enter into the search bar the link (address) of a specific page with a violation, and not the domain name of the entire service.- Roskomnadzor did not explain the reasons for changing the search mechanism in the registry of blocked sites. A representative of the public organization Roskomsvoboda, in a comment to ASTRA, said that in this way the department probably decided to make the register of blocked pages non-public. The organization reminded that it is still possible to monitor blockings the old way through their website even if prohibited links do not appear there immediately, but with a slight delay.The actions of Roskomnadzor fit into the general trend towards increasing the secrecy of information in Russia. So, since the beginning of the war, your data and statistics classified has already been classified by more than a dozen departments. And yesterday it became known that the websites of Moscow courts have stopped showing what exactly people are being arrested for. This complicates the work of journalists and human rights activists in finding those accused of political charges.

Previously confirmation of the use of the winged FAB-3000 in Ukraine was published. Title: ‚Ü©Ô∏èüñº The Russian Aerospace Forces again dropped an aerial bomb on...
Description: ASTRA: The Russian Aerospace Forces again dropped an aerial bomb on the Belgorod region According to ASTRA sources in the emergency services of the Belgorod region, on October 10 in the Shebekinsky urban district, in FAB-500 was found several kilometers from the village of Neklyudovo. There were no casualties or damage.According to ASTRA estimates, this is at least the 128th air bomb that fell on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine from March to October this year.As before told ASTRA, to counter Ukrainian air defense, the Russian army began to equip Soviet FAB aerial bombs with UMPC complexes. After this update, FABs now have wings and satellite guidance, allowing them to launch bombs directly from Russian territory. Previously confirmation of the use of the winged FAB-3000 in Ukraine was published. The numbers in the name of such bombs indicate the total weight of the product.The Russian army began actively using the UMPC in the spring of this year. And the problem with the updated FABs was immediately revealed - often the bombs simply do not reach Ukraine. According to ASTRA estimates, in total, from March to September, Russian planes dropped at least 128 aerial bombs on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine. FAB-250 and FAB-500 fall most often. Usually, during an emergency gathering, they do not explode - the bombs are destroyed after the fact by explosives technicians. At the beginning of July, FAB-3000 fell for the first time from a Russian plane in the Belgorod region. A bomb exploded in a field near Shebekino. Since the bomb fell in a field, there were no casualties. May 4 a Russian plane dropped a FAB-500 on Belgorod, as a result of which 7 people were injured, 31 households and 10 cars damaged. The authorities hid the reason for the bomb's fall, as well as the fact that it was Russian.ü´® Subscribe to ASTRA.
